summary:
• Director Shareholding Disclosure (Dividend Reinvestment Plan):
  • Director: Alistair Douglas Petrie (via Bartel Holdings Limited).
  • Transaction Type: Acquisition of 161,564 ordinary shares (TRA) under Dividend Reinvestment Plan (May 2023).
  • Total Consideration: $1,067,938.04 NZD.
  • Total Holdings Post-Transaction: 12,027,586 shares (via Bartel Holdings Limited) + 40,011 shares (beneficially owned).
  • Closed Period Trade: Yes (no prior clearance details provided).

No other material information identified.

• Type: Capital Change Notice
  • Issuer: Briscoe Group Limited (NZX: BGP)
  • Instrument: 164,657 Performance Rights issued (0.0739% dilution post-issue)
  • Key Terms:
  • Each right converts to 1 ordinary share upon vesting (no exercise price).
  • Vesting conditions: 50% tied to 3-year TSR growth, 50% to 3-year EPS growth (vesting date: after 2027/28 results).
  • Lapse if performance unmet or employment ends pre-vesting.
  • Total Outstanding: 575,019 Performance Rights (no treasury stock).
  • Purpose: Long-term executive incentive program.
  • Authority: Board resolution (24 July 2025) + NZX Listing Rule 4.6.1.

No material trading or capital structure impact identified beyond dilution upon vesting (2028).

• FY25 Financial Performance Update:
  • Underlying EBITDA: $100–$110M (vs. $45.2M in FY24).
  • Underlying NPAT: Breakeven (vs. -$60.4M in FY24).
  • Reported Net Loss After Tax: -$27M to -$40M (vs. -$182.1M in FY24).
  • Reported EBITDA: $50–$68M (vs. -$4.1M in FY24).

  • Target Closing Net Debt: $300M.

  • Operational Issues:

  • Manufacturing challenges at Dunsandel facility (resolved) led to one-off FY25 costs.

  • Covenants & Timing:

  • Compliant with banking covenants; final audited results due 29 September 2025.

No material capital markets actions (e.g., raising, trading halt) identified.

EROAD FY25 Group Climate Statement – Material Information Summary

Key Takeaways for Capital Markets Participants:

Climate-Related Disclosures & Strategy

  • Second annual climate statement aligned with Aotearoa New Zealand Climate Standards.
  • Net Zero Commitment: Target to achieve net zero Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions by 2050, with interim science-aligned targets:
  • 54.6% reduction in absolute Scope 1 & 2 emissions by 2033 (2023 baseline).
  • 61% reduction in emissions intensity (per $1M revenue) by 2033.
  • Scope 3 Emissions: 98% of FY25 total emissions (11,416 tCO2e, down 53% YoY), excluding "use of sold products" (immaterial per adoption provisions).
  • Transition Plan: Focus on decarbonizing operations, customer enablement (e.g., fuel efficiency tools), and supply chain resilience.

Operational Highlights

  • FY25 Achievements:
  • Freight/logistics: Shifted to rail (NZ) and bulk shipments; reduced air freight reliance.
  • Circular economy: 100% hardware recycling (global rollout vs. NZ-only in FY24).
  • Fleet/energy: Downsized fleet vehicles, migrated to EVs, and switched NZ electricity to 100% renewable (Ecotricity).
  • Customer Impact:
  • Refrigerated fleets using EROAD tools achieved 65% pre-cooling time reduction and 50% fewer temperature faults.
  • AI dashcams ("Clarity Edge") improved safety, reducing fuel waste from incidents.

Financial & Risk Management

  • FY25 Spend:
  • $0.2M on emissions tools (Watershed), advisory (PwC), and assurance (Toitū).
  • $1.6M invested in FY24 for NZ Sustainability Module (1,005 active accounts by FY25).
  • Risks:
  • Transition: Policy/tech shifts (e.g., EV adoption), competition in emissions tracking.
  • Physical: Supply chain disruptions from climate events (low material impact to date).
  • No material climate risks identified in FY25; integrated into enterprise risk framework.

Governance & Metrics

  • Board/FRAC oversight; Sustainability Committee drives initiatives.
  • Assurance: Toitū provided reasonable assurance for Scope 1–2, limited assurance for Scope 3.
  • Key Metrics:
  • Emissions intensity: 58.72 tCO2e per $1M revenue (down 60% vs. FY23).
  • Contracted units: 255,845 (up 13% vs. FY23).

Conclusion: Progress on decarbonization and customer solutions, but Scope 3 remains a focus. No immediate trading impact; monitor execution against 2033 targets and EV/telematics competition.

Note: Excluded non-material operational updates, director details, and legal boilerplate. Focused on data impacting valuation, liquidity, or capital structure.

• CEO Appointment: Nikhil Ravishankar (current Chief Digital Officer) appointed as new CEO, effective 20 October 2025, replacing Greg Foran.
  • Leadership Transition: No material operational or strategic changes announced; focus on continuity with emphasis on digital transformation and innovation.

No other material information identified for trading or capital markets decisions.
